meanings.definition: To set or establish boundaries or limits
meanings.sent1: The teacher demarcated the play area for the children with colorful cones.
meanings.sent2: The demarcated property line prevented any disputes between neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The demarcated line between the two teams in the game made it easy to know who was on which side.
meanings.sent4: Her smile demarcated the joy in her heart, shining brightly for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The demarcated path through the forest was like a ribbon guiding hikers to their destination.

meanings.sent1: The artist demarcated the colors in the painting to create a beautiful contrast.
meanings.sent2: The demarcated sections in the garden showcased different types of flowers.
meanings.sent3: The demarcated flavors in the ice cream cone surprised her taste buds with each bite.
meanings.sent4: His words demarcated the truth from the lies, leaving no room for confusion.
meanings.sent5: The demarcated boundaries of the city were like lines on a map, defining its shape and size.
